name: Jih Schedular
author: joelharkes

sections.description:
A new plugin where people can schedule in hours into a timetable.
easily when they are registered or with recaptchawhen they are not.

This plugin is heavenly reliant on you using a theme which uses bootstrap ass layout base.

This is the long description. No limit, and you can use Markdown (as well as in the following sections).

For backwards compatibility, if this section is missing, the full length of the short description will be used, and
Markdown parsed.

A few notes about the sections above:

Configuration

  1. Go to this menu and add the reCaptcha keys in the settings.
  2. Add the calendars you want.
  3. Add the post, added by this plugin, in your menu so people can go to this page.

1.3.0

  • Added option to only let logged in users book hours
  • Shows popup now notifying settings are saved (admin)
  • Fixed some texts to also be Dutch
  • Show more user friendly dates in popup
  • Logged in users can now overwrite there username and email in booked hour

1.2.8

  • Added setting for visibility calendar select box

1.2.7

  • Added plugin css setting

1.2.6

  • Update stable version

1.2.5

  • Fix Calendar name was not showing on page load.

1.2.4

  • Fix readme. Update stable version to this corresponding plugin version.

1.2.3

  • Add localisation for dates (moment.js is used for dates)

1.2.2

  • Add localisation support. (Dutch added, english default)

1.2.1

  • Hotfix for include file warning

1.2

  • Set to active version

0.1

  • Initial check-in of the plugin to wordpress
sections.installation:
Install the plugin. A menu will be added to the admin menu.

  1. Upload plugin-name.php to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress and you’re done installing
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

Install the plugin. A menu will be added to the admin menu.

  1. Upload plugin-name.php to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress and you’re done installing

I want something to work a bit different, why does it work this way?

For the right price i’ll update the plugin for you. Contact me on jlharkes@gmail.com

short_description: A schedule in your wordpress website where (unregistered) people can sign up for an hour.

A new plugin where people can schedule in hours into a timetable.
easily when they are registered or with recaptchawhen they are not.

This plugin is heavenly reliant on you using a theme which uses bootstrap ass layout base.
